content.title: Double Aortic Arch
content.description: Complete vascular ring formed by persistent bilateral aortic arches

key_concepts.details: Two arches encircle trachea and esophagus, joining posterior to form descending aorta
Stridor, respiratory distress, feeding difficulties; often symptomatic in infancy
CTA or MRA demonstrates complete ring; barium swallow shows posterior esophageal indentation
Surgical division of lesser (usually left) arch and ligamentum arteriosum

content.clinical_significance: Most common symptomatic vascular ring; typically requires surgical repair
